SEARCH
Package com.myfinanceapp.model

Class Goal

java.lang.Object
com.myfinanceapp.model.Goal
public class Goal extends Object
Represents a user's financial goal. A goal can be a savings target, debt repayment, or budget control. Each goal has a target amount, current amount, and optional deadline.
Version:
4.0
Author:
SE_Group110

  • Constructor Details

    • Goal

      public Goal()
      Default constructor. Creates an empty Goal object, properties need to be set using setter methods.

    • Goal

      public Goal(String id, String userId, String type, String title, double targetAmount)
      Creates a Goal object with basic properties.
      Parameters:
      id - Unique identifier for the goal
      userId - ID of the user who owns this goal
      type - Goal type
      title - Goal title
      targetAmount - Target amount for the goal

    • Goal

      public Goal(String id, String userId, String type, String title, double targetAmount, double currentAmount, LocalDate deadline, String category, String currency)
      Creates a Goal object with all properties.
      Parameters:
      id - Unique identifier for the goal
      userId - ID of the user who owns this goal
      type - Goal type
      title - Goal title
      targetAmount - Target amount for the goal
      currentAmount - Current amount achieved
      deadline - Deadline for goal completion
      category - Category of the goal
      currency - Currency unit, if null defaults to CNY

    • getProgressPercentage

      public int getProgressPercentage()
      Calculates the goal completion percentage. Returns 0 if target amount is 0. Returns 100 if completion exceeds 100%.
      Returns:
      Goal completion percentage (0-100)

    • isCompleted

      public boolean isCompleted()
      Determines if the goal is completed. For budget control type, goal is considered complete when current amount is less than or equal to target amount; For other types, goal is considered complete when current amount is greater than or equal to target amount.
      Returns:
      true if the goal is completed, false otherwise
